articles.content:
S. Korean Religious Elders Write to U.S. President 
    Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- More than 100 religious elders of south Korea mailed a letter calling for the peaceful settlement of the "nuclear issue of the north" to U.S. President Bush on January 11, according to MBC of south Korea.
 The political, social, economic and security issues of the Korean Peninsula cannot be resolved by military means, they said in the letter, stressing:    
The nuclear issue of the north should be resolved in a peaceful way through dialogue.

articles.title: Material Concealing Truth about "Comfort Women for Japanese Army"�@Discovered
Single-minded Unity of Korean People Praised
articles.content:
Material Concealing Truth about "Comfort Women for Japanese Army"�@Discovered 
    Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The Institute for the Study of the Issue of Volunteers' Corps in south Korea discovered the material proving that the Japanese army sought to conceal the truth about the operation of the "comfort women for the army" in an organized manner, MBC of south Korea reported.
 It said: Recently the institute discovered in the "State Archives" a list of employees in army units worked out by the Japanese army. It contained the real names of "comfort women" who survived. Those women are recorded there as employees of hospitals at the end of the war.    
 The truth about the "comfort women" should thoroughly be probed as the list is the first of its kind proving the Japanese army's attempt to conceal it in an organized manner. This material is likely to be used as strong evidence refuting the assertion of the Right-wing elements of Japan denying the system whereby Korean women were forced to serve as comfort women and committing the Japanese government to owning its responsibility and making reparation for it.

articles.title: Anniversary of DPRK-Turkey Diplomatic Ties Commemorated
articles.content:
Single-minded Unity of Korean People Praised 
    Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The Korean people have firmly defended their system even under the present complicated international situation because all the army and people have united around leader Kim Jong Il as one in mind.
 President of Congo Denis Sassou Nguesso said this when meeting with DPRK ambassador to Congo Ri Won Son on Jan. 6.
  The Korean people's efforts for the peace and security of the Korean Peninsula are supported by different countries of the world, he noted, adding: The government and people of Congo have backed and cooperated with the Korean people in international arena, valuing the friendly relations with them.    
  He hoped for closer cooperation and exchange in political, economic and other fields in the future, too. He also expressed the hope that the Korean people will successfully carry out the tasks set forth by the Workers' Party of Korea and the government this year to significantly greet major holidays.
